item.description:
This new bakery and cafe is the brainchild of Ana Sortun, owner/chef of Oleanna restaurant and author of the fabulous "Spice" cookbook. I am on a mission to taste every one of the exotic Middle Eastern pastry creations offered at Sofra, from Syrian shortbreads to umm-ali (Egyptian bread-and-butter pudding) to chocolate hazelnut baklava. There are savory snacks too, cheese boureks, stuffed flatbreads, and lots more.

Why a Monday afternoon? Because I've asked the management when their slowest time of the week is -- and that's what they told me. It's not a big place, and we really don't want to venture in there on a weekend! And who knows -- leaving work a tad early for something like this just might have you looking forward to a Monday!

I know we won't get many people to show for this, so I'm not charging a reservation fee for this Meetup. And wait, folks, there's more. . . I'll treat the first 3 people to RSVP to the beverage of their choice. Of course, you have to show up to collect!
item.how_to_find_us: It's a real small place. I'll be hard to miss!
item.name: Tea/Turkish Coffee and Exotic Pastries at Sofra
